abstract: Bess Myerson, who parlayed her pop culture celebrity as first Jewish Miss America into a position of enduring political influence, dies at age 90; led two New York City agencies, championed social causes, supported powerful political careers and ran for Senate before her own career imploded amid scandal; will be remembered as a favorite daughter of New York City.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Myerson, the only Jewish Miss America, was one of a select group of American figures to parlay pop culture celebrity into positions of influence in government.

byline.contributor: Jack Kadden and Daniel E. Slotnik contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ENID NEMY and WILLIAM McDONALD

snippet: Ms. Myerson, the only Jewish Miss America, was one of a select group of American figures to parlay pop culture celebrity into positions of influence in government.

headline.main: Bess Myerson, New Yorker of Beauty, Wit, Service and Scandal, Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: Bess Myerson, 90, Dies; New Yorker of Beauty, Wit, Service and Scandal
